title: Purse, 1820–40
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: embroidery using satin, stem, knot and couching stitches on plain weave moiré
description: Ladies' bag of white moiré silk embroidered in colored silks. Shape is five-sided, flat, with a scalloped top. Borders of flower wreaths. Embroidered on one side with a greyhound and with a long-tailed bird on the other. Worked as two separate panels, joined. Lined in pale blue taffeta. Blue and white silk cord.

tombstone.epitaph:
Purse, 1820–40.
1820–40. Medium: silk
Technique: embroidery using satin, stem, knot and couching stitches on plain weave moiré. Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf. 1951-105-12.
